So I'm implementing a writer as a disposition processor, and using
WriterPool. The problem I have is that I can't find a way to reliably stop
the Heritrix job when I encounter a problem. The best I have found so far
is to throw an Error from the constructor of WriterPool, which (I think)
will pause the job. But exceptions from `WriterPool.makeWriter` or
`WriterPoolMember.write` do not pause the job, they are logged but treated
as recoverable, though in this case they're not! Is there another way to
pause the job from a writer?


Many thanks

--047d7b6da6ee44d8560506702e23
